column36: Drainage / ditch clearing
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column82: During an activity that caused a ground disturbance within the prescribed area
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Drainage / ditch clearing
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column36: Grading / leveling
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (h) unless otherwise agreed upon by the pipeline company at the person that is engaged in the activity, notify the pipeline company at least 24 hours before backfilling over a pipe
column84: (a) Ensure that the construction is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent; (c) Comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed while carrying out the construction in the vicinity of a pipe and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (c) Not construct or place any kind of pole, pylon, tower, guy, anchor or supporting structure across, on, along or under the pipeline.; (e) Carry out any construction that involves the interference with or alteration of a pipe under the pipeline companys supervision

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security
column84: (c) Comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed while carrying out the construction in the vicinity of a pipe and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (c) Not construct or place any kind of pole, pylon, tower, guy, anchor or supporting structure across, on, along or under the pipeline.

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (f) carry out any activity that involves the interference with or alteration of a pipeline under the companys supervision

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (b) ensure that the activity is completed within two years after the day on which the consent was obtained, unless the pipeline company and the person agree on another time period that is set out in the consent; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (e) if interference with or alteration of a pipeline becomes necessary, obtain the pipeline companys written consent to interfere with or alter the pipe; (f) carry out any activity that involves the interference with or alteration of a pipeline under the companys supervision; (g) immediately notify the pipeline company of any contact with the pipe or its coating during the activity; (h) unless otherwise agreed upon by the pipeline company at the person that is engaged in the activity, notify the pipeline company at least 24 hours before backfilling over a pipe
column84: (a) Ensure that the construction is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent; (b) Ensure that the activity is completed within two years after the day on which the consent was obtained, unless the pipeline company and the person agree on another time period that is set out in the consent; (c) Comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed while carrying out the construction in the vicinity of a pipe and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (c) Not construct or place any kind of pole, pylon, tower, guy, anchor or supporting structure across, on, along or under the pipeline.

If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Drainage / ditch clearing
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (f) carry out any activity that involves the interference with or alteration of a pipeline under the companys supervision

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of maintaining an existing facility
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column36: Grading / leveling
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security
column84: (a) Ensure that the construction is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent; (c) Comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed while carrying out the construction in the vicinity of a pipe and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security; (h) unless otherwise agreed upon by the pipeline company at the person that is engaged in the activity, notify the pipeline company at least 24 hours before backfilling over a pipe

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of maintaining an existing facility
column82: During an activity that caused a ground disturbance within the prescribed area
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column36: Excavation for the purpose of installing a new facility
column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (b) ensure that the activity is completed within two years after the day on which the consent was obtained, unless the pipeline company and the person agree on another time period that is set out in the consent; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation; (d) comply with the instructions of the pipeline companys authorized field representative regarding the procedures that are to be followed during the activity and that relate to the pipelines safety and security

column83: (a) ensure that the activity is carried out in accordance with the technical details that are set out in the persons request for consent and that have been accepted by the pipeline company, as well as with the conditions set out in the pipeline companys consent, including the conditions respecting directional drilling or the use of explosives; (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation

column83: (c) not undertake mechanical excavation that would cause a ground disturbance within the prescribed area within 3 M of a pipe unless </br>(i). If the excavation runs parallel to the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at sufficient intervals to confirm the pipes location or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location; </br>(ii). If the excavation crosses the pipe, the pipe has been exposed by hand at the point of crossing or the pipeline company has used a method that would permit it to confirm the pipes exact location and has informed the person of that location and has confirmed that the pipe is at least 60 CM deeper than the proposed excavation; and </br>(iii). If the ground conditions render it impractical to locate the pipe using any of the methods set out in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), the pipeline company directly supervises any excavation
